alert.note: Alert for Pribilof Islands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 05 at 4:12PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS THIS WEEKEND ALONG WITH SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN... A powerful storm system moving into the Bering Sea late Friday will bring another round of very strong winds to the Pribilof Islands this weekend. Easterly winds will quickly increase late Friday night becoming southeasterly through Sunday morning. Expect sustained winds of 35 to 50 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. There may be a brief lull in the strong winds late Saturday evening through early Sunday morning before winds shift to the southwest and increase late Sunday morning through Monday morning. Expect sustained winds of 35 to 50 mph with gusts to 65 mph during this second round of strong winds. The winds are then expected to diminish through Monday evening as the low lifts into the Bering Strait. A brief period of snow is likely late Friday night. However, temperatures will quickly warm into the mid to upper 30s as the winds increase, changing any snow over to rain.
